Package net.viktorc.pp4j.impl

Class SimpleProcessManager

  • Object
    • AbstractProcessManager
      • SimpleProcessManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProcessManager, Resettable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JavaProcessManager
    public class SimpleProcessManager
extends AbstractProcessManager
    A simple sub-class of the AbstractProcessManager class that relies on instances of functional interfaces passed to its constructor to implement the startsUpInstantly(), AbstractProcessManager.isStartedUp(String, boolean), getInitSubmission(), and getTerminationSubmission() methods.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  SimpleProcessManager.ProcessStartupPredicate
      A bi-predicate that may throw FailedStartupException for determining when a process is started up based on its output.

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SimpleProcessManager​(ProcessBuilder builder, Charset charset)
      Constructs a manager for the processes created by the specified ProcessBuilder assuming that the process starts up instantly.

      Constructs a manager for the processes created by the specified ProcessBuilder assuming that the process starts up instantly.

      Constructs a manager for the processes created by the specified ProcessBuilder assuming that the process starts up instantly.
      SimpleProcessManager​(ProcessBuilder builder, Charset charset, SimpleProcessManager.ProcessStartupPredicate startupPredicateStdOut)
      Constructs a manager for the processes created by the specified ProcessBuilder assuming that the process does not start up instantly and its startup is determined by the provided startup predicate.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleProcessManager

        public SimpleProcessManager​(ProcessBuilder builder,
                            Charset charset,
                            SimpleProcessManager.ProcessStartupPredicate startupPredicateStdOut,
                            SimpleProcessManager.ProcessStartupPredicate startupPredicateStdErr,
                            Long keepAliveTime,
                            Supplier<Submission<?>> initSubmissionSupplier,
                            Supplier<Submission<?>> terminationSubmissionSupplier)
        Constructs a manager for the processes created by the specified ProcessBuilder assuming that the process does not start up instantly and its startup is determined by the startup predicates.
        Parameters:
        builder - The instance to build the processes with.
        charset - The character set to use to communicate with the managed process.
        startupPredicateStdOut - The predicate to use to determine when the process can be considered started up based on its output to its standard out stream.
        startupPredicateStdErr - The predicate to use to determine when the process can be considered started up based on its output to its standard error stream.
        keepAliveTime - The number of milliseconds after which idle processes are terminated. If it is null, the life span of the process will not be limited.
        initSubmissionSupplier - The optional initial submission supplier for generating the submission to submit to the process right after it started up.
        terminationSubmissionSupplier - The optional termination submission supplier to use to generate the submission to terminate the process.

      • SimpleProcessManager

        public SimpleProcessManager​(ProcessBuilder builder,
                            Charset charset,
                            SimpleProcessManager.ProcessStartupPredicate startupPredicateStdOut,
                            Long keepAliveTime,
                            Supplier<Submission<?>> initSubmissionSupplier,
                            Supplier<Submission<?>> terminationSubmissionSupplier)
        Constructs a manager for the processes created by the specified ProcessBuilder assuming that the process does not start up instantly and its startup is determined by the provided startup predicate. The constructed instance throws a FailedStartupException if anything is printed to the process' standard error during startup process.
        Parameters:
        builder - The instance to build the processes with.
        charset - The character set to use to communicate with the managed process.
        startupPredicateStdOut - The predicate to use to determine when the process can be considered started up based on its output to its standard out stream.
        keepAliveTime - The number of milliseconds after which idle processes are terminated. If it is null, the life span of the process will not be limited.
        initSubmissionSupplier - The optional initial submission supplier for generating the submission to submit to the process right after it started up.
        terminationSubmissionSupplier - The optional termination submission supplier to use to generate the submission to terminate the process.

    • Method Detail

      • isProcessStartedUp

        public boolean isProcessStartedUp​(String outputLine,
                                  boolean error)
                           throws FailedStartupException
        Description copied from class: AbstractProcessManager
        It determines whether the line output by the process denotes that it has successfully started up.
        Specified by:
        isProcessStartedUp in class AbstractProcessManager
        Parameters:
        outputLine - The line output by the process.
        error - Whether the line was output to the process' standard error stream or its standard out stream.
        Returns:
        Whether the output line denotes the startup of the process.
        Throws:
        FailedStartupException - If the output line denotes that the startup of the process has failed.

      • startsUpInstantly

        public boolean startsUpInstantly()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessManager
        Determines whether the process should be considered started up instantly or if it is only started up once a certain output is printed to its standard out or standard error streams. If it returns true, the process is immediately considered started up and ready as soon as it starts running. If it returns false, the method ProcessManager.isStartedUp(String, boolean) determines when the process can be considered started up.
        Returns:
        Whether the process can be considered started up and ready for submissions immediately after it starts.

      • getInitSubmission

        public Optional<Submission<?>> getInitSubmission()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessManager
        Returns an optional submission to execute upon the startup the process. No other submissions are to be accepted until this submission is processed. If the returned optional is empty, no initial submission is executed.
        Returns:
        The optional initial submission that is for setting up the process for later submissions.

      • getTerminationSubmission

        public Optional<Submission<?>> getTerminationSubmission()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessManager
        Returns an optional submission for terminating the process. It allows for an opportunity to execute commands to close resources or to exit the process in an orderly way. If the returned optional is empty, the process is killed forcibly.
        Returns:
        The optional termination submission for shutting down the process.
